title: Activity-Based Simulation Training for Enhancing Anticoagulant Management Competency

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pharmaceutical/medical knowledge and patient counseling experience
context.additional_context: Systematic learning of the entire process—from anticoagulant prescription to patient monitoring—through real-time patient simulations and role-playing activities using VR equipment.

learning_goals: Learners can apply anticoagulant dosage adjustment and bleeding risk assessment protocols with 90% accuracy
By role-playing as patients in simulations, learners can demonstrate empathetic communication skills at 80% proficiency or higher
Through team projects, learners can develop anticoagulation therapy guidelines and achieve peer evaluation scores of 4.0/5.0 or higher
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
